title: Marginalia
content: Marginalia are notes, comments, or illustrations added in the margins of a book or manuscript. The practice dates back to medieval manuscripts where scholars would annotate texts with their thoughts and references.

title: Navigation Benefits
content: Studies show that clear navigation structures like a table of contents can reduce bounce rates by up to 25% on long-form content, as readers can quickly find sections relevant to their interests.

title: Citation Formats
content: The Bibliography component supports various citation formats including APA, MLA, and Chicago styles. The format shown here is a simplified version that includes author, year, title, and publisher.
